Something refreshing.
Something new.
Something for you.

We’re launching our newest range of products tomorrow 😎

Any guesses what they might be?

#Phool #newproductslaunch #comingsoon #wellness #aromatherapy #organic #newlaunch

We don't know if history will remember us and our efforts to clean up our river Ganga, but we are super glad the History Channel did recognise our efforts! ☺️ Do give it a watch, some new updates in the video as well!

#Phool #historychannel #ganga #historytv18 #historytv18india

* From Ganga to Antarctica *
Over time, Phool has grown into a small little organisation filled with extremely passionate environmentally conscious individuals. This Earth Day, we are proud to share the story of one of our colleagues @anup_misal15, who was chosen to be part of a once in a lifetime environmental expedition to the Last Great Wilderness- the Antarctica! 

Anup represented India at Mission 2041- a climate force Antarctic expedition. This mission chooses leaders of tomorrow from various sustainability backgrounds and aims to engage them in dialogue, interactions with fellow global leaders in climate science and promote sustainable practices. The most important aspect of this mission is their travel to Antarctica where leaders get to see first hand the effects of our actions on Antarctica and how quick proactive action is the only way to save our beloved planet earth.

For all of us at Phool, sitting in Kanpur, witnessing Antarctica through the eyes of a colleague who we have worked with together for years, getting real time pictures and videos shared on our group chats of penguins, seahorses, the magnificent icebergs, the violent sounds of winds and hearing the stories he came back with, for 20 days we felt that we were in Antarctica ourselves!

Having cleared 8 grueling rounds of personal and written interviews, and raising funds where all of us collectively contributed and helped spread the word, for us at Phool there was no prouder moment than to see our colleague get selected and make it on a journey of a lifetime! 

Most importantly, we got to hear perspectives from him on what we only read in articles and blogs, on how our actions have a real time impact and how much more we have to do to keep this planet beautiful for all the future inhabitants! 

The expedition has made our resolve stronger to keep marching on the chosen path and hope that one day all of us at Phool will also get a chance to interact with fantastic passionate individuals working for a better tomorrow.

We hope on this #Earthday, you find your inspiration as much as we have and join us in making our planet a little better everyday.
#EarthDay #GangatoAntarctica #saveantarctic

Phool Natural Gulaal is our earnest attempt at reviving the ancient tradition of making pure Gulaal from flowers and herbs. It is believed that thousands of years ago, the Gopis made Gulaal the same way, bestowing the most vibrant flowers upon the okhali to make colours for the first Holi of Radha Krishna. And as Lord Krishna applied this Gulaal to his beloved Radha, the trees and flowers began to bloom with happiness, giving way to the most prosperous season of the year- Spring.

As we went back in time to experience what that tradition must have felt like, we experienced spring come early at Phool as our faculty turned into a canvas of colours, flowers, painting the brightest smiles of our women flowercyclers. Such was the beauty of the process that it inspired a poem which encapsulates the entire journey from a flower to a gulaal. 

So, we captured the experience of making Phool Natural Gulaal in this video for you, just as we saw it, through the eyes of a flower.

We hope their journey fills your heart with joy, just the way it did ours.

#PhoolWaliHoli #GulaalKiKahani

The colour of Magnificence, of Depth and of Serenity, Blue is the colour of God signifying calmness and peace in life. It is the color of Krishna’s complexion and also of the sky and the oceans. Blue symbolizes strength and life and is known for being one of the prime colours during Holi adding vibrancy to the celebrations!

Phool Natural Blue Gulaal is made from Indigo and Beetroot. Handmade from flowers offered at temples by our women flowercyclers and fresh ingredients sourced directly from local farmers, this chemical-free Gulaal has a light and fine texture blended with refreshing essential oils to add joy and color to your Holi Festivities!

If blue is your favourite colour, you should definitely try out our Phool Natural Blue Gulaal!

#PhoolWaliHoli

One of the few things we ensure invariably is to be able to lend credibility to our claims. To ensure that you as a customer are getting exactly what we claim. If you have been following up with our previous posts, you would know that we mentioned that this year, Phool Natural Gulaal is extra special for us at Phool. This post is an attempt to draw your attention to “that” something special this Holi! Have you guessed it already? No? Alright alright, we’re going to spill the beans now! 😁

📢📢 Phool Natural Gulaal is verified by Ecocert Greenlife under COSMOS standard, the highest global standard for Natural and Organic Cosmetic products!! What this means is that our ingredients are 100% plant-derived and this isn’t just a claim anymore. It has been validated by the highest global standard for Natural and Organic Cosmetic products - Ecocert Greenlife. Every ingredient, every supply chain has gone through rigorous on site audits conducted by experts from this industry thrice every year!

This certification is a byproduct of our unwavering resolve to make honest products as we keep growing. 

This certification validates our resolve to make products that are good for you, good for the people who make it and good for the planet.

Head on over to our website and get yourself Certified Natural Phool Gulaal today!

#PhoolWaliHoli

Phool Natural Gulaal is our earnest attempt at reviving the ancient tradition of making pure Gulaal from flowers and herbs. As we went back in time to experience what that tradition must have felt like, we experienced spring come early at Phool as our faculty turned into a canvas of colours, flowers, painting the brightest smiles of our women flowercyclers.

Such was the beauty of the process that it inspired a poem which encapsulates the entire journey from a flower to a gulaal.

“Gulaal ki kahaani, phoolon ki zabani,
Kal tak khushboo bikherti,
Aaj woh rang bikherne chali…
Gulaaalan ke bazuuon ki mehnat ne,
Okhli par haldi ko vaar diya,
Dheemi dheemi aanch par baith,
Taambe ki degh mei khud ko samet,
Aaj woh rang bikherne chali…”

There’s more to this poem which we shall reveal in the coming days! Stay tuned with us to celebrate a #PhoolWaliHoli

When we decided to make Phool Natural Gulaal, one thing we were very clear about was that we would get these colours certified for skin safety. Over the years, a lot of people have stopped playing with colours and indulging in the festivities of Holi due to substandard quality colours containing harmful chemicals. We started hand-making colours from temple flowers, non-GMO cornstarch and freshly sourced local ingredients and then put our product through rigourous skin safety certifications to understand if we had achieved what we had set out to do in the first place. We were elated that our efforts had met with success.

Taking a step ahead this year, we have ethically tested Phool Natural Gulaal for skin sensitisation and safety by the Centre for Cruelty Free Testing (FIST Centre by Dept. of Science and Technology, Govt. of India at MIET).

Our commitment to making skin friendly certified gulaal was validated when we received a feedback from a consumer who said that she celebrated Holi with colours after almost a decade!! Such testimonials are all that we need! 🙂

We would love to add joy and colour to your festivities this year as well! 

Head over to our website www.phool.co to buy your box of Phool Natural Gulaal and make it a #PhoolWaliHoli!

We at Phool just love festivals! The anticipation of reunions, get-togethers, lip-smacking festive food, the small little tea and dinner party sessions with our families and friends and the joy of giving gifts and receiving gifts! 

Perhaps Holi is the grandest one of them all, a festival full of nostalgia and colour, and for us at Phool probably amongst the busiest time of the year! From preparation of colour, to getting certifications in place, photoshoots and intricate design and last minute dispatch, it is an absolute roller coaster! 

Sticking to our ethos of making products good for you, good for the people who make it and good for the planet, the Phool Natural Gulaal this year is a little more special! 

You should definitely head over to our website and check for yourself what’s different this year and make this Holi a #PhoolWaliHoli

Yes, Yes, YES! 

It is almost time for the launch of the Holi collection 2022! 

The story of how Phool Natural Gulaal came into being is as beautiful as the product itself. Back in 2019, one of our women flowercyclers came up with a suggestion, "भईया हमने सुना है, फूलों से भी रंग बनता है, क्या हम भी कर सकते है ये?”

This mere suggestion was the birth of our tryst with natural colours. 

Phool Natural Gulaal is an earnest attempt at reviving the lost tradition of making Holi colours with 100% pure and natural plant ingredients, handmade from flowers offered at temples and fresh ingredients sourced directly from local farmers. The bright pigments of hand picked flowers and herbs rich in therapeutic properties lend their beautiful hues and fragrance to the Phool Gulaal. Pictured here is an elaborate process of pounding the dried colours to ensure uniformity in texture of the Phool Natural Gulaal! 

Our women flowercyclers are ready for #PhoolWaliHoli, are you!?

Christmas to a lot of us signifies a time of reunion, family gatherings and joy. A time of celebration, merry making and relishing in some delicious bakes with lots of hot chocolate indulging in the Christmas spirit!

While Christmas celebrations mean something different for each of us, be it  planning fancy Christmas dinners, or finding the perfect Christmas gift, we forget that maybe Christmas isn’t just about gatherings and hearty meals but a time to reflect and thank the ones who matter the most.

As we dive into the festive cheer, let’s also take this day to:

Appreciate someone who has meant a lot to you, and let them know! 

Forgive someone against whom you still hold a grudge, and let them know!

Be kind to someone who seems to be having a tough day, and offer a helping hand or lend a listening ear!

And most importantly, remember to share these same gifts with yourself because YOU deserve it.

We hope you’ve been able to find some cheer amongst the ups and downs life might’ve presented you with this year. We are sure you have come out stronger than you were when this year began. We hope you stay kind to yourself and be your own secret Santa, showering yourself with that occasional self-appreciation as you battle this thing called life!

MERRRY MERRRYYYY Christmas to you and your loved ones, from all of us at PHOOL! 🎅🎄⛄✨🎁

In this age and time we often tend to forget why is it that people were so overjoyed to see their King back after 14 long years. Why, on the day of the new moon when there wasn't a single light in sight did the people of Ayodhya light a multitude of earthen diyas, decorate their homes and courtyards to celebrate the homecoming of their King?

What was it about Shri Ram that inspired this incredible wave of happiness that even today HE inspires generations?

Perhaps Tulsidas and his 'Ramchartiramanas' could provide us with some clues!

For him, Rama was, 'sab ke priya sab ke hitkari' (beloved of all and loved by all). He is benevolence incarnate, chivalrous and valorous but always gentle and caring. Compassionate towards the weak and the vulnerable, and magnanimous towards the enemy even when he chastises them for what is wrong.

The birth of Rama, Tulsi says, heralded the one who is merciful, and who is eternally considerate to the weak and needy. Tulsidas also goes on to describe Ram as ‘karuna sukh sagar, sab guna aagar’ — one who is the very reservoir of kindness and joy, and endowed with every auspicious attribute. 

Even when Ram meets Kaikayi, He is not angry or vengeful but as a true "Maryada Purshottam" tells her, the son who gets to obey his Mother and Father is a blessed one.

Maybe the love his people showered him with was a direct consequence of his ideology of a state of everyone living in harmony and love for one another.

May this Diwali we always remember His message of the greatest Dharma being the welfare of others. May we try to emulate him in our speech, actions and thoughts and try to overcome the evil within ourselves. 

We hope we could add some value to your diwali celebrations with our efforts to bring out the facets of Diwali. We would love to hear your interpration of the Lord in the comments below as well! 

PHOOL wishes you all a very Happy Diwali!

✨ The Ritual She Passed On ✨

This Mother’s Day, Mom’s Therapy has teamed up with @phool.co to bring you something truly special — customisable care hampers that celebrate the rituals passed from one hand to another.

Whether it was warming oil before every champi…
Or the ways she tied your hair in braids the way only she could.

We want to hear it:
What’s one thing your mom did that you still pester her to do whenever you meet her?

Share that one heartfelt ritual she passed on to you in the comments 💌

A few of these stories will win our handcrafted combo hampers — made to nourish, comfort, and carry forward her love.

🎁 Winners to be announced on 9th May!

Because this time, we’re doing it differently — for the mothers, daughters, and every quiet caregiver in between.

latestPosts.caption:
🌸✨ Phool Wishes You a Joyous & Colorful Holi! ✨🌸 

Holi isn’t just a festival of colors; it’s a celebration of joy, togetherness, and childhood memories that refuse to fade—just like the gulaal on our faces! Remember those carefree days of chasing friends with pichkaris, sneaking in water balloon attacks, and ending the day drenched in laughter and colors? Holi takes us back to that pure, unfiltered happiness. 

Rooted in tradition, Holi marks the victory of good over evil, symbolized by the legend of Prahlad and Holika. It reminds us to let go of negativity, mend broken bonds, and embrace life with open arms. As we smear colors on each other, we dissolve differences and celebrate the spirit of unity and love. 

May this Holi fill your life with vibrant hues of happiness, warmth, and new beginnings! 🌈🎉 Happy Holi from Phool!🌸🔥 #HappyHoli #FestivalOfColors #PhoolWishesYou

🌸✨ Their smiles shine brighter than Phool’s vibrant colours ✨🌸 

We all miss our childhood friends—the ones who knew us for who we truly were. But imagine how much more our **grandparents, nanas, nanis, dada-dadis, ajobas, and ajjis** must miss their childhood friends, old colleagues, or even kids who’ve moved away for work. 💭💖 

This Holi, take a moment to spend time with the seniormost members around you—because trust us, their smiles will shine brighter than Phool’s vibrant colors! 🌈😊 

Also, a special shoutout to the amazing team at @goodfellowsindia , who spread joy in the most heartwarming ways! We had the privilege of celebrating with them last to last year, and we still look back at that memory with so much love. 💕 

Let’s make this Holi about love, laughter, and togetherness—across all generations!✨🎉 

#HoliWithHeart #CelebrateTogether #SpreadSmiles #PhoolColours #GoodfellowsIndia

Behold the awe-inspiring moment when Lord Narasimha, the fierce incarnation of Vishnu, emerges to uphold dharma! This sculpture captures the legendary tale of Hiranyakashipu—the tyrant king who defied the gods, believing himself invincible. Blessed with a boon that he could not be killed by man or beast, inside or outside, by day or night, with weapons or bare hands, he ruled with unchecked arrogance, demanding that all worship him instead of Lord Vishnu. 

But his own son, Prahlad, remained devoted to Vishnu, enraging the king. In his final act of defiance, Hiranyakashipu challenged Prahlad, asking if his god resided even in a pillar. The moment he struck it, Narasimha emerged—half-man, half-lion—dragging the tyrant to the threshold at twilight and tearing him apart with his claws, fulfilling the prophecy in every way. 

Every intricate detail in this masterpiece has been brought to life by the skilled hands of @sculptorrakeshkashyap , who spent 40 hours crafting this vision of devotion and power. With just his bare hands, he has transformed stone into a story—one of faith, justice, and the triumph of good over evil. 🔱✨ 

A true work of art, and a tribute to an immortal legend! 🎭🔥 #Narasimha #DivineArt #Sculpture #Hiranyakashipu #handcrafted

latestPosts.caption:
Legend has it that Gujiya was once offered to Lord Krishna during Holi, symbolizing the sweetness of devotion and the triumph of good over evil. Even today, this golden, crispy delight remains at the heart of Holi celebrations. 

As the festival approaches, the air fills with the aroma of cardamom, roasted khoya, and deep-fried dough - a scent that brings back cherished memories of laughter, togetherness, and festive kitchens buzzing with joy. Rolling, stuffing, sealing, and frying—Gujiya-making is an art, a tradition, and a celebration in itself! 

The first batch goes to the temple, the next to guests, but the hottest, crispiest ones? Always enjoyed fresh, too tempting to resist! 💛🌈 

Holi is incomplete without the joy of making, sharing, and savoring Gujiya—a taste of love, nostalgia, and tradition. What’s your favorite Holi memory?🍬🎉 

#GujiyaLove #HoliTraditions #SweetMemories #FestiveFlavors #HappyHoli
